page.title: 05Cramlington:Home Life
page.content: Most homes have parents and children, usually about 2 children per house. Most families live in houses. Most houses are new and are gas centrally heated. There are 3 bedrooms, 1 kitchen, a bathroom and a living room in a typical house. Some people have dining rooms and some have utility rooms. Many people have electric washing machines which wash clothes in hot water. We hang them on a line to dry again. Most parents go to work. We have freezers which keep food fresh for a long time. These are very useful. Refrigerators keep food cool. All houses have cookers. Some have microwaves. We like to watch T.V. We have 4 channels to choose from. We have videos, which record T.V. programmes. Eastlea F.S.
